Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*UN Entry to Yemen: There are limited commercial flights entering or leaving Yemen. The majority of land sea and air ports are closed until further notice. For Sana’a please refer to the UNHAS schedule, and staff should go for a mandatory 14 days self-isolation in the United Nations Common Accommodation Facility (UNCAF). Please note that there is a staff ceiling, quarantine requirements and a very limited accommodation that affect the UNHAS bookings to Sana’a. For Aden, please refer to the UNHAS schedule, and staff should go for a mandatory 14 days self-isolation in the WFP guest house. New update: the staff member who can provide a medical certificate with a negative coronavirus (COVID-19) PCR test result issued at most 72 hours before departure, should consult UN clinic upon arrival to Aden and if approved by UN clinic the 14 days self-isolation will be exempted. Please note that there is a staff ceiling, quarantine requirements and a very limited accommodation that affect the UNHAS bookings to Aden. For national staff, they should go for a mandatory 14 days self-isolation at their own homes.
There is no requirement to provide a vaccination certificate or negative PCR or antigen test certificate to enter Yemen.
*If you’re fully vaccinated: Entry requirements for Yemen are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*Proof of vaccination status: There is no requirement to provide a vaccination certificate or negative PCR or antigen test certificate to enter Yemen.
*If you’re not fully vaccinated: Entry requirements for Yemen are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*If you’ve had COVID-19 in the past year: Entry requirements for Yemen are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*Children and young people: Entry requirements for Yemen are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*If you’re transiting through Yemen: Entry requirements for Yemen are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.
*Exemptions: Entry requirements for Yemen are the same for all travellers, regardless of COVID-19 vaccination status.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Yemen: Authorities across Yemen have introduced a range of measures. These include curfews, movement restrictions, closures of businesses and limitations on public and private gatherings. Implementation may vary and restrictions can change at short notice. Some areas have designated quarantine camps. These can vary in both quality and access to medical provision.
